docs.snippet: The death of Gabriel García Márquez set off a flurry of obituaries and appraisals, as well as appreciations from Latin American readers in New York who grew up in the world Mr. García Márquez described.

docs.snippet: Paris St Germain collected their first trophy of the season when Edinson Cavani's double secured a 2-1 victory against Olympique Lyon in the French League Cup final on Saturday.

docs.snippet: Under Óscar Tabárez, the national soccer team for Uruguay has undergone a slow revolution, finishing third at the 2010 World Cup and winning the 2011 Copa América.
docs.lead_paragraph: Under Óscar Tabárez, the national soccer team for Uruguay has undergone a slow revolution, finishing third at the 2010 World Cup and winning the 2011 Copa América.
docs.abstract: Uruguay's national soccer team has undergone a slow-burning revolution under coach Oscar Tabarez, finishing third at 2010 World Cup and winning 2011 Copa America; it is uncertain whether he will renew his contract after 2014 World Cup in Brazil, causing unease among the players and fans who revere him.

headline.main: In Uruguay, Team and Country Are Unified Behind Coach
headline.print_headline: In Uruguay, Team and Country Are Unified Behind Coach

docs.snippet: Arsenal midfielder Jack Wilshere should be fit to return for the FA Cup final against Hull City next month and "just polished" enough to make England's World Cup squad, manager Arsene Wenger has said.

docs.snippet: Uruguay's government is still writing the rules for its legal marijuana market, two weeks overdue now, and President Jose Mujica has asked that no details be released until the regulations are published Friday or Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's government is still writing the rules for its legal marijuana market, two weeks overdue now, and President Jose Mujica has asked that no details be released until the regulations are published Friday or Monday.

headline.main: Uruguay to Limit Pot Buyers to 10 Grams a Week
headline.print_headline: Uruguay to Limit Pot Buyers to 10 Grams a Week

docs.snippet: Uruguayans will be able buy up to 10 grams of pot a week, enough to roll 20 joints, under new rules governing the recently legalized marijuana trade in the country, a government source said on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguayans will be able buy up to 10 grams of pot a week, enough to roll 20 joints, under new rules governing the recently legalized marijuana trade in the country, a government source said on Thursday.

headline.main: Uruguay to Allow Pot Users to Buy Up to 20 Joints a Week
